definitions.definition: A trench cut in the soil, as when plowed in order to plant a crop.
definitions.example: Don't walk across that deep furrow in the field.

definitions.definition: Any trench, channel, or groove, as in wood or metal.
A deep wrinkle in the skin of the face, especially on the forehead.
definitions.example: When she was tired, a deep furrow appeared on her forehead.

definitions.definition: To cut one or more grooves in (the ground, etc.).
To pull one's brows or eyebrows together due to concentration, worry, etc.
definitions.example: As she read the document intently her brows began to furrow.
